column5: Has any one used Slate falls fly ins? looking to fly in to hooker lake,any input will help.Any other really good camps out there? we will be targeting walleyes.Thanks Gene

Gene yes I have used Slate Falls. My group flew into their facility on Eagle Island on Lake St. Joseph last August and had a fantastic trip!Verne Hollett is among the very best outfitters I have used.Have never fished Hooker but have heard good things about it. If you're interested you can see the detailed write up on my trip with Slate Falls here. It will certainly give you good idea of what to expect when dealing with Verne:http://www.canadafishingguide.net/la...eye-beat-down/

Mike is right on...Slate Falls and Verne are the very best. I have not been to Hooker (or and other houses of ill repute) but we flew into Eagle Island on St. Joe and it was the best walleye/northern fishing I have ever experienced in bot size and numbers. And, I have fished a lot of lakes over many years in Ontario. Wherever you go, Have A Blast!

This year will be our first trip through slate falls. Going to eagle island in july. We have fished Hooker lake and the adjoining lakes to the north for the last ten years, if you need any info on them feel free to pm me.
I haven't yet but I'm booked for Maskara in July. Can't wait. Sent from my SM-T810 using Tapatalk
Thanks for all the info . We are going to book with Vern

MikeThanks for such another excellent write up along with videos & photos on Slate Falls on your web page, we'll definitely be putting this outfitter on our top of outfitters to fish with soon.Vernes web page http://slatefallsoutposts.com/dont-f...acker-planner/is one of the most comprehensive packer-planners I've ever read. What a wonderful read for both the experienced and novice to fly-in fishing!Again ThanksJeff
